page.title: 04TOURISM 2
page.content: The main attraction for tourists is not hard to find;you just have to look around at the crags of Craigower outlined against a deep blue sky,the lush green fields with cows dotted in picturesque patterns, and the swirling water of the River Tummel contrasting with the calm of Loch Faskally.There are a number of specially provided nature trails in the vicinity of the town.Special attractions exist like the festival theatre, and the Dam and fish ladder which lures approximately 500,000 visitors a year.There are also historical reasons for visitors with strong Jacobite and late Victorian connections.A Highland night is presented twice weekly at the Recreation ground complete with a pipe band and local singers and dancers. In September there is the Highland Games .
